docs.text: battlefield long , boring and just plain stupid
docs.label: negative

docs.text: battlefield earth
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a film review by michael redman copyright 2000 by michael redman
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in my mid-teen years , i had a horrendous re-occurring nightmare .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: behind the wheel of a car , i was driving down a straight road in the middle of a desert .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: no scenery except the horizon line and the converging parallel lines of the highway .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: no matter what i did , the view didn't change : travelling but not getting anywhere .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: each time i awoke in a sweat , terrified .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you don't have to be carl jung to understand that dream .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: powerless to make changes , trapped in a boring situation with no hope of rescue , this is the stuff of nightmares whether we are asleep or awake .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this is exactly how you will feel 15 minutes after " battlefield earth " begins .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for all of its flash and style , l . ron hubbard's science fiction epic is the earliest and best entry for the dullest summer film of 2000 .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: dull " and " stupid .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the year 3000 , the psychlo aliens have ruled our planet for 1 , 000 years .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: humans either work as slave labor in mining operations or live as barbarians .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's no hope .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the future is bleak .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: then the psychlo make a mistake and capture feisty jonnie goodboy tyler ( barry pepper ) who organizes a revolution against chief of security terl ( john travolta ) and the alien race .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's an archetypal post-apocalyptic plot full of promise .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: considering some of the talent involved and all the millions thrown at the screen , it's difficult to see how it could have failed so miserably .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but it does .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the story is so full of holes that it falls apart within minutes of the opening credits .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: are we really supposed to believe that after a millennium of looking for gold , the psychlo never discovered fort knox ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: or that fighter planes are still in pristine condition after all that time -- and gassed up ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: or that the cavemen become such expert pilots in seven days that they can easily down the advanced alien ships ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: or that the psychlo spy cameras somehow don't notice that their slaves are missing for days ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: travolta prances across the screen hamming it up for all he's worth and is almost entertaining .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: almost .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the rest of the actors are wooden mannequins trying not to laugh while delivering lines that no person -- " man-animal " or not -- would ever utter .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: some of the film _looks_ good , but it also looks so familiar .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a race of large hulking ape-like creatures has taken over the world while our cities lie in ruin .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sound like something charlton heston might be in ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the psychlo look like overweight klingons in gear from " dune " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the final air battle between the air force fighters and the psychlo ships in their high-tech city is something george lucas might have been associated with .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's too loud .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's too oppressive .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's too slow .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's too long . . . far
docs.label: negative

docs.text: too long .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and on it goes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the list of the problems with " battlefield earth " is endless .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's difficult to find anything in the film that does work .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: oh yeah .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the color scheme is nice .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the real question is how this movie ever got made .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: could it have something to do with the fact that l . ron hubbard was the founder of scientology ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and that john travolta is a member of the church .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that might explain why travolta bought the rights to the novel years ago .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but it doesn't give us a clue as to why first-time screenwriter corey mandell's atrocious script was used .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: or why the high-profile project was entrusted with roger christian who had never before directed a major film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: or why no one looked at this thing before it was released and realized there might be problems .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the one bright spot is that no longer will kevin costner's " the postman " ( which i begrudgingly admit as a guilty pleasure ) be " the " big budget science fiction failure .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " battlefield earth " has the honor sewed up .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: often reviewers will recommend that you skip mediocre films and wait for the video .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that's not the case here .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you can act now and make the decision to not see it on the big screen or on the small one .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: don't hesitate .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: strike now while the iron is cold .
docs.label: negative
